p: In a tetragonal phase C 11, C 12 and C 33 correspond to the linear compression resistance along the a, b and c axis. In all cases C 11 and C 33 are the highest values. This indicates that linear compression along these axes should be lower. The smallest difference between C 11 and C 33 is for the Nb 5Sn 2X phases, suggesting that these are less anisotropic than the Ti 5Sn 2X phases. If these values are compared with the binary βNb 5Si 3 phase [ 11], which has the D8 m structure, the difference between C 11 and C 33 is in all cases smaller (between 10 and 30 GPa for ternary phases compared with approximately 60 GPa for βNb 5Si 3). In beta Nb 5Si 3, the 8 h and 4a Wyckoff positions are filled with Si atoms, whereas in the ternary phase, the 8h position contains Sn atoms. This suggests that the presence of a large, element such as Sn, in the 8h Wyckoff position reduces the anisotropy of the W 5Si 3 phase.
